text: Royal Museum of Scotland is on Chambers Street, Edinburgh, UK. It is part of the National Museums of Scotland, the other part being the adjacent Museum of Scotland. Both names merged with each other in 2007 to become the National Museum of Scotland. It was designed by Francis Fowke and built from 1861-1888. == References == http://www.scottisharchitects.org.uk/architect_full.php?id=201226 Category:1861 architecture
title: Royal Museum
